social_posts.post_text:
Merry-making has made its way into the master bathroom! A few red hand towels, some cinnamon-scented candles and decorating.done.

So, a little “before and after” reel of the changes we’ve made in here. I’m a sucker for ANYTHING before and after. Homes, weight loss, hair styles...you name it, I’m madly swiping back and forth and am, by and large, always über impressed with what a few changes can do. I mean, B&As are a literal picture of the power of change; the opportunity to step outside of “what’s always been” to “what can be”! 

As a rule, I like change but sometimes the
thought of it is overwhelming, especially when I feel like I’m losing control…kinda like this project. 😬😂 But the truth is, life itself is full of changes over which I usually have little control so I can either fear, accept or even embrace it. Below is a favorite song on my playlist that speaks to where I want to land. 

“I’ve never been good at change
If I’m honest, it’s always scared me
But I can’t deny this stirring deep inside me
Now I know it’s time to stop resisting
‘Cause I’m not getting any younger
Fear is a such a sad way to live a life
So face to the wind, I’m jumping out, I’m walking in
Every single thing You want to show me” 
—Into Faith I Go by Pat Barrett 

Good stuff. So, eyes open today to the opportunity and beauty of change that God wants to show me. Thankfully, it’s a whole lot cheaper than a bathroom remodel. 🙂

“Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the LORD your God will be with you wherever you go.”
—Joshua 1:9

Merry Makeover!

25 days! TWENTY.FIVE. 🥳

“…but the angel reassured them. “Don’t be afraid!” he said. “I bring you good news that will bring great joy to all people. The Savior—yes, the Messiah, the Lord—has been born today in Bethlehem, the city of David!”
—Luke 2:10,11

Merry CHRISTMAS! ❤️

Decorating early this year was really unusual for me. And by “unusual” I mean weird. The good part is—like here in the dining room—I can tweak for weeks! My guy says that’s the bad part. 😒 I, on the other hand, say the bad part is having everything set and then scrolling around and seeing these creative, amazing, gorgeous, blow-your-mind homes pop up and thinking either, “I.need.to.add.MORE!” or “Oh. Wait. This is too much. Wayyy too much. You need to go. And you and you…” Kinda the inner minimalist aficionado waging war with the outer maximalist scenario. Any one? 🙋🏼‍♀️ But when I remember the best part…NONE OF IT REALLY MATTERS, ANN!…well, all is well. Because whether I place the last strand of tinsel on in October or we drag a tree in the house on Christmas Eve, at the end of the day what actually matters…the heart of everything…is celebrating the birth of my Savior Jesus Christ and this glorious Good News:

“For it is by grace [God’s remarkable compassion and favor drawing you to Christ] that you have been saved [actually delivered from judgment and given eternal life] through faith. And this [salvation] is not of yourselves [not through your own effort], but it is the [undeserved, gracious] gift of God; not as a result of [your] works [nor your attempts to keep the Law], so that no one will [be able to] boast or take credit in any way [for his salvation].”
‭‭—Ephesians‬ ‭2‬:‭8‬-‭9‬

Undeserved, gracious gift of God…my life verse right there. All the rest is the fun extra! 

So, note to self: Christmas on but stay calm! And pass the tinsel please. 🙂

#Christmascrazy 
#staycalm 
#alliswell #Jesusisthereasonfortheseason 
#Christmasdecorating

Guest room, guest ready. ✔️

♥️🤍 

We’ll have a merry little Christmas now! 

"Sleep is a laying aside of care, a forgetfulness of need, a quiet leaving of matters with God...note how Jesus slept amid the hurly-burly of a storm at sea! He knew that He was in His Father's hands, and therefore He was so quiet in spirit that the billows rocked Him to sleep..."
—C.H. Spurgeon 

“You will keep in perfect peace all who trust in You, all whose thoughts are fixed on You!”
—Isaiah 26:3

Guest goals. ✔️😴

#sleepwell #guestroom #cozybedroom #Christmasbedroom #Christmasbedding #bedroomstyling #bedroomdecor #Christmasdecorating #cottageChristmas #cbholidaybedrooms

Joy comes in the morning! 

The gorgeous winter sunshine streaming in here is what makes cleaning the skylights worth it! (At least that’s what I tell my guy when he’s balancing on a ladder with a pail of soapy water. 🙂) I mean, depending on the time of day and year, these blue tiles can go from ocean blue to a smoky blue-gray and blue hues in between. *Swipe* to see what they looked like this time last year. Then swipe again to see where we started. Light years away. 😎

Speaking of light…

“The people who walked in darkness have seen a great light. For those who lived in a land of deep shadows—light! sunbursts of light! You repopulated the nation, you expanded its joy.
Oh, they’re so glad in your presence! Festival joy!
The joy of a great celebration,
sharing rich gifts and warm greetings...
For a child has been born—for us!
    the gift of a son—for us! For a child has been born—for us!
    the gift of a son—for us!
He’ll take over
    the running of the world.
His names will be: Amazing Counselor,
    Strong God,
Eternal Father,
    Prince of Wholeness.”
—Isaiah 9 The Message 

For us. ✨ That’s Merry Christmas! 

#morninglight #skylights #bathroomremodel #bathroomreno #bathroomdesign #bathroominspiration #bathroomremodel #bluetiles #Christmasbathroom

Morning light.  All is calm, all is bright. ✨

Shining some light on views of our haint blue ceilings which I haven’t shown much. Painting ceilings blue (usually porches) is a southern thing. It originated from a Gullah tradition that’s quite interesting to read about but mostly I just like that it’s pretty pop of color. With the red and white bedding, kind of a twist on a blue blue Christmas. 😎💙 

Merry Monday! 

“Don't shine so others can see you. Shine so that through you, others can see Him.”
—C.S. Lewis

“In Him was life, and that life was the light of all mankind. The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it.”
—John 1:4,5

Beyond thankful for the life and light of Jesus!

Nighttime view. Christ, the JOY of Christmas! ✨

“Who can add to Christmas? The perfect motive is that God so loved the world. The perfect gift is that He gave His only Son. The only requirement is to believe in Him. The reward of faith is that you shall have everlasting life.” 
—Corrie Ten Boom

Joy to the world! 
The Lord has come
Let earth receive her King!

#joy #JesusChrist #Jesusisthereasonfortheseason  #cozyhome #cottagelife #cottageChristmas  #Christmaslights #Christmastree #treetopper #Christmastreedecor #lantern #mypotterybarn  #walldecor #repurpose #repurposed #Christmasdecor #reflections #reflectionshot #coastalChristmas #farmhouseChristmas #Christmaslightdecor #Christmaslightdecorating #deckthehalls

O Christmas Tree! O Christmas Tree!
How richly God has decked thee!
O Christmas Tree! O Christmas Tree!
How richly God has decked thee!
Thou bidst us true and faithful be,
And trust in God unchangingly.
O Christmas Tree! O Christmas Tree!
How richly God has decked thee!
—German Christmas Carol

"Nothing ever seems too bad, too hard, or too sad when you've got a Christmas tree in the living room." 
—Nora Roberts

So true! So thankful. ♥️

"It is good to say thank you to the Lord, to sing praises to the God who is above all gods. Every morning tell Him, ‘Thank You for Your kindness,’ and every evening rejoice in all His faithfulness. Sing His praises...You have done so much for me, O Lord. No wonder I am glad! I sing for joy."
~Psalm 92:1-4 TLB

Have yourself a Merry little Christmas now! ❤️

#MerryChristmas2022 #Christmasjoy #rejoice #Christmasspirit #Christmastree

The stockings were hung by the chimney with care..little did we know we wouldn’t be there. 😳🎄A quick retrospective reel of the Christmas when we (🙋🏼‍♀️) went all in decorating and then decided to leave town! 

It was a lot of fun dressing up this little fixer-upper beach babe after missing out the last couple of years but the thing we realized after decking our halls, nothing could possibly compare to the joy of being with our real beach babes across the ocean. So, we opted to give each other an early Christmas gift, hopped on a plane and we’re currently making merry in Maui! 🎄🎄🎄

The unplanned things of life are definitely some of the sweetest but as we sat in church with our family yesterday and listened to the message on all of the hundreds of prophecies that foretold the birth of Jesus, I was overcome with gratitude for the magnificent plan God had when He sent His Son to be the savior of the world. I mean, this wasn’t just a random last minute decision. This was the greatest.plan.EVER.

““For God so [greatly] loved and dearly prized the world, that He [even] gave His [One and] only begotten Son, so that whoever believes and trusts in Him [as Savior] shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge and condemn the world [that is, to initiate the final judgment of the world], but that the world might be saved through Him.”
‭‭John‬ ‭3:16-17‬ ‭AMP‬‬

That’s Good News and that’s why a weary world rejoices! 

Aloha and Mele Kalikimaka!🌴♥️
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#Jesusisthereasonfortheseason  #Rejoice #MerryChristmas #MeleKalikimaka #aloha #earlyChristmas #earlyChristmasgift #lastminutegifts #familytradition #motherdaughterlove #grandparentslove  #grandbabies #currentsituation #currentdesignsituation #fixerupper #fixerupperstyle #beachcottage #beachhousedecor #cottageChristmas #Christmasdecorating #cottagestyle #homedecorating #homedecorideas #cottagesandbungalows #countrylivingmag #bhghome

Lord willing…and Southwest Airlines cooperates 🙏🏼🤞🏼…we’ll be making it back to this little house by the sea in time for the New Year’s Eve countdown! All the Christmas decor will still be up *swipe* and we’ll have to deal with all our dead landscaping (thanks unanticipated cold wave) but man, so worth it to have spent these last few days of the year with our family across the ocean! 

And while enjoying a Mele Kalikimaka with them was the best of the best, saying goodbye is always the worst of the worst.  That said, the silver lining is this: doing so just means a hello is in the near future! And that’s how I’m looking at 2022. Albeit difficult in many ways, because we also saw a multitude of good things come this past year—chief among them another beautiful grandbabe—there’s a measure of sadness in saying goodbye to a sweet season. But there’s also the hopeful expectation of saying hello to “…immeasurably more than all we ask or imagine, according to His power that is at work within us…”
(Ephesians 3:20) in 2023. All to say, while extremely thankful for past blessings there’s also great anticipation of opening the gift of new beginnings.♥️

So, happy New Year’s Eve, cheers, and here’s to making it back to home sweet home before the clock strikes twelve! ✈️🥂🥳

“…I focus on this one thing: Forgetting the past and looking forward to what lies ahead…”
—Philippians 3:13

#hopeforthefuture 
#outwitheoldinwiththenew #homesweethome #newyearseve

Soooo, just sitting at the Charlotte, NC airport waiting for a plane to take us back home after visiting our Maui babes. After almost 24 hours of travel we came to the last leg for a short hop back to the island only to be told the plane has electrical issues 🫠 but it’s given me time to reflect on the amazing, memory-making time we had with our family and how beyond grateful I am for the ability to cross an ocean to see them! Definitely don’t take it for granted. Thank you/Mahalo @karleycreates for another wonderful our-hearts-are-so-full visit! 

I came across this recently and it spoke to my heart of not only the joy of this season but how to translate it into every day life. 

“Because children have abounding vitality, because they are in spirit fierce and free, therefore they want things repeated and unchanged. They always say, “Do it again”; and the grown-up person does it again until he is nearly dead. For grown-up people are not strong enough to exult in monotony.
But perhaps God is strong enough to exult in monotony. It is possible that God says every morning, “Do it again” to the sun; and every evening, “Do it again” to the moon. It may not be automatic necessity that makes all daisies alike; it may be that God makes every daisy separately, but has never got tired of making them. It may be that He has the eternal appetite of infancy; for we have sinned and grown old, and our Father is younger than we.”
—C.K. Chesterton 

So so good. ❤️

Aloha until we meet again! LYTTMAB 😘

#family #familyvisit #familyiseverything #daughtersarethebest #grandchildren #grandbabiesarethebest #happymemories #aloha #maui #mauihawaii #wonder #Godislove

Home.Sweet.Home. 

“Let the morning bring me word of your unfailing love, for I have put my trust in you. Show me the way I should go, for to you I entrust my life.”
—Psalm 143:8

Back at Grace Cottage after weeks of being away and settling back in to the day to day here. Beyond thankful for the opportunity to be with our family across the ocean and missing them lots but now that we’re home, thankful for this little beach babe to come back to. Currently catching up on a) sleep and b) projects, one of which I just completed…de-pinking in here. I’ve been wanting to get back to pure coastal colors again (my idea of neutrals 🙂) but I gotta say I already miss that pop of fun color. I mean, pink really, really captured my color-happy heart!  Not that it’s gone entirely…still have plenty to spare according to my guy 😏…so we’ll see if it lasts! 

New day, new hope, new opportunities, new adventures! Or, it could just be a wonderfully ordinary day.  Either way, I’m thankful for the here and now. 

“LORD, remind me how brief my time on earth will be. Remind me that my days are numbered— how fleeting my life is.”
—Psalm 39:4 

And to make the most of them! 💓

#homesweethome #morningview #currenthomeview #thankful #beachhouse #beachhousedecor

The words, “I’ll be home for Christmas…” have never warmed this heart MORE. ❤️ Our family across the ocean is coming to the mainland for the holidays and merry making and happy dancing have commenced! Well played Mr. Buble. Literally, well played. 🎵😎

But even sweeter and dearer to my heart than those of Michael B are these words from O Holy Night:

Long lay the world in sin and error pining
‘Til He appears and the soul felt its worth
A thrill of hope the weary world rejoices
For yonder breaks a new and glorious morn
Fall on your knees; O hear the Angel voices!
O night divine, O night when Christ was born
O night, O Holy night, O night divine!

For me, this is the true joy, the true hope, the true promise of the Christ of Christmas, especially in these tumultuous times. But getting to rejoice with family? Man, definitely the sweetest icing on the Christmas cake. ❤️

All that said, maximalist tendencies in overdrive over here y’all. #howmuchistoomuch 🤔😬😂 Coastal Christmas 2023 here we come! 

#IllbehomeforChristmas #thethrillofhope #coastalChristmas

Welcome to the beach house! ‘Tis the season, y’all, rejoice! 

O come, all ye faithful, Joyful and triumphant! O come ye, O come ye to Bethlehem; Come and behold him Born the King of Angels:
O come, let us adore Him, O come, let us adore Him, O come, let us adore Him, Christ the Lord.

Despite the darkness of this world; despite the circumstances of life; despite hurt, pain, loss...I can rejoice! Full disclosure: sometimes it’s a struggle because of those very things and the enemy of my soul wars against that joy. But the good news is, 1.) I don’t have to find joy in my own strength; He will provide it when I ask and 2.) this isn’t my forever home. One day, because of the Christ of Christmas, I forever be in His Presence and there will be no more tears or sorrow. Life certainly brings great happiness at times as well and I’m so thankful for each and every moment because this girl (“girl”) loves to laugh and have fun! (Did I mention our daughter and her family are coming home for the holidays?!) But with or without those mountaintop moments, I can and will rejoice in Jesus as Savior of the world.❤️

Welcome Christmas 2023! 

“Always be full of joy in the Lord. I say it again—rejoice!” 
-Philippians 4:4

“Don’t be dejected and sad, for the joy of the LORD is your strength!”
—Nehemiah 8:10

#joytotheworld 
#Rejoice 
#homesweethome 
#magicofChristmas 
#Christmastree

#Christmasdecor
#holidayhome

#holidayinspirations

Oh, it’s definitely that time of year…❤️#currenthomeview

So, some back story: Last year I kind of (actually) went all in for Christmas decorating as I’d missed out the previous couple of years and decided—even though it would just my guy and me + friends—it would still be festive and fun to make merry around here. But then, after the halls were duly decked, we made the spur-of-the-moment decision to leave it all behind, pack our bags and head to Maui to spend Christmas with our family. What a whirl wind 😵‍💫 but still, best “to us, from us” gift ever! 

So, with our crew returning the favor by coming home for the holidays, all the bins came down [again]and all the stuff went up [again]. And really, I didn’t make a ton of changes from last year because, you know, a) we left and b) family didn’t get to see it and c) well, I kinda liked it! 

And while I know absolutely none of this stuff is necessary to celebrate the birth of Jesus, man, how I appreciate this passage from The Message:

"Seize life!...
Oh yes—God takes pleasure in your pleasure!…(❤️ this) 
Each and every day of your precarious life. 
Each day is God’s gift. It’s all you get in exchange
For the hard work of staying alive.
Make the most of each one!
Whatever turns up, grab it and do it. And heartily!"
Ecclesiastes 9:7-9

So, enjoying this gorgeous gift of today and seizing life (and the bins) like a crazy Christmas lady! #noshame 

#itsthattimeofyear #homefortheholidays #Christmastree 
#OhChristmastree  #Christmasdecor #Christmasdecorations 
#cozyChristmas 
#cottageChristmas

"It is good to say thank you to the Lord, to sing praises to the God who is above all gods. Every morning tell him, “Thank You for Your kindness,” and every evening rejoice in all His faithfulness. Sing His praises...You have done so much for me, O Lord. No wonder I am glad! I sing for joy."
—Psalm 92:1-4 TLB

Thankful for this new day! Also thankful to wake up here at Grace Cottage and for the opportunity it has opened to share not just our home but the One Who gave us this little cottage by the sea. That has been a most unexpected blessing. We don’t know how long this season will last—we never thought this would be our forever home—but man, what a fun ride it’s been so far! That said, for whatever reason, we’re kind of in this phase of wondering if change is on the horizon. There’s this sense of restlessness that we can’t quite identify and we start asking all those “what if” questions. Which, you know, can lead to some serious rabbit trail wandering.🫠 Anybody?🙋🏼‍♀️ 

The good news is that while we don’t know what the future holds, by His grace we know the One who does. And for me that means keeping my eyes on God and trusting Him for His best today (and man, is that a forever work in progress!) while still hoping for His best tomorrow. Whatever the case, Lord, prepare this heart. 

In the meantime, the thought of change makes me want to make the most of every moment even more than usual. Which is maybe a good reason (read: excuse) to add maybe one more [insert Christmas decor item] in here because, hey, go big or go home!

Merry Christmas and Maranatha! 

#thankful #change #MerryChristmas #merryandbright #Christmashome #Christmasdecor #Christmasdecorations #bedroomdecor #bedroomdesign #bedroomideas #bedding #masterbedroom #interiors #interior123 #coastalChristmas #farmhousestyle #cozyhome #coastaldesign #cottagestyle #cottagesandbugalows #countrylivingmagazine #cottagefarmhouse

Sunday morning + current view = Happy Place 🙂♥️

So, totally unintentional but when I took this IPhone shot, I didn’t notice that the little Christmas tree on the right hid part of the Merry Christmas sign hanging above so from here it reads CHRIST.  So yeah, Merry CHRISTmas! 

Good reminder for me because despite my obvious affection (read: obsession) for maximalistic decorating this time of year (my husband literally asked where he was suppose to sit 🙄😂), at the end of my days I'm not going to take any of this fun stuff with me! And I know it won't matter in the least when I'm in the presence of Jesus, the Christ of Christmas; King of Kings and Lord of Lords. ♥️ Forever thankful for the love, forgiveness and grace God extended to this former broken girl through the birth, life, death and resurrection of Jesus Christ, my Lord and Savior. Since then, He’s been my hope through every dark day, every tear cried, every prayer offered, every day given and every joy experienced. And one day when I’m in His presence, that’ll be my true Happy Place but until then, Happy Sunday from Grace Cottage and Cheers to a new week! ☕️☕️

“Blessed and fortunate and happy and spiritually prosperous (in that state in which the born-again child of God enjoys His favor and salvation) are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness (uprightness and right standing with God), for they shall be completely satisfied!" 
—Matthew 5:6 The Message 

🙌🏼

#Jesus #Godislove #thankful #happyplace #MerryChristmas #Christmascheer #currenthomeview
